target_title: Incorrect or expired accounts credentials notifications are not set as critical urgency, and do not remain pinned
Remove Microsoft option
rClone integration?
Setting up Microsoft 365 returns "No such secret item at path..." error

note.body:
I can confirm this, also on an AMD notebook. Stock Ubuntu 24.04 install.

```
Package: gnome-online-accounts
Status: install ok installed
Priority: optional
Section: gnome
Installed-Size: 284
Maintainer: Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com>
Architecture: amd64
Version: 3.50.4-0ubuntu2
```

I'll try to get debug logs soon.

note.body:
Hi and thanks for the detailed report!

I agree a47ebe0f is likely the cause here. Can you confirm that the error code is `GOA_ERROR_FAILED`? If it's another error code it should be detected, so this would imply `GOA_IDENTITY_MANAGER_ERROR_INITIALIZING` is being incorrectly return by the identity manager.

target_title: Changes in the OAuth2 settings on the server

note.body:
Thanks for the write-up, I'm bit unclear on some bits though.

> The very old version uses a `redirect_uri` `"https://login.live.com/oauth20_desktop.srf"`, which you replaced with `"goa-oauth2://localhost/"GOA_WINDOWS_LIVE_CLIENT_ID;` (by the way, there should be a space before the define "variable") [...]

So there are two client IDs (as you note in comment below): the old one is for a Windows Live service but Rishi and I discovered the admin portal is EOL'd, and the new one is the Microsoft 365 account. Ideally we could add the `goa-oath2://` scheme for the old client ID, because I think the old redirect URI requires a WebView.

> [...] and because you removed the old URI on the server, then the old clients are rejected by the Microsoft OAuth2 wizard with an error that the `redirect_uri` does not match any defined for the `client_id`. There can be set multiple redirect URIs on the server, if I'm not mistaken.

If this is something that just started happening, I wonder if Microsoft just shut down the service? We couldn't access the Windows Live admin portal so the URL wasn't changed/removed (although I should have bumped the `get_credentials_generation()`).

I can't find anything stating Windows Live has been shut down, but I assume that has happened if this is only old versions using the previous client ID?

target_title: No way to edit online account settings after creation

note.body:
> I think the issue described here is that when you change your password in the origin service you will not be able to change it in goa.

GOA frequently ensures credentials still work, by routinely logging in to each account. If a login fails for an existing account, the user will be notified and can update the credentials in GNOME Settings. As of GNOME 47, you should get a notification as well.

> This approach is far from ideal because evolution does not recognise the new account as the old one and therefore resynchronizes all again. Not to mention that all account-related customizations are gone as well.

This won't apply, if you allow GOA to update the credentials. If there's a problem refreshing credentials this way then that's definitely a bug and you can open a new issue for that :slight_smile:

target_title: No way to edit online account settings after creation

note.body:
> This comment came through email, but was lost in recent infrastructure updates

[Ulf Seltmann](@smoebody) commented: 

I think the issue described here is that when you change your password in the origin service you will not be able to change it in goa. Therefore in order to re-enable support for this account you will have to delete it and create it again. This is especially relevant for IMAP/SMTP Accounts.

This approach is far from ideal because evolution does not recognise the new account as the old one and therefore resynchronizes all again. Not to mention that all account-related customizations are gone as well.

In case this does not get picked up again here my workaround:

    open $HOME/.config/goa-1.0/accounts.conf
    find the account-id from the section header. should be in format account_<timestamp>_x
    use secret-tool to find the entry in the keyring:

    $# secret-tool search goa-identity "imap_smtp:gen0:account_<timestamp>_x"

    The content of secret should be a JSON-like string with imap-password and smtp-password in plaintext.
    Take the string and modify it to contain the new credentials
    Delete the old entry:

    $# secret-tool clear goa-identity "imap_smtp:gen0:account_<timestamp>_x"

    Create a new entry:

    $# secret-tool store --label "Choose what you want, preferably the label from the old entry" \
         "goa-identity" "imap_smtp:gen0:account_<timestamp>_x"

    When prompted for password paste the modified secret string in. the new entry will have a different schema but goa does not seem to care at all.
    stop evolution, evolution-*, goa-daemon, goa-identity-service
    start evolution.

The Account should be retrievable again.

target_title: Setting up webdav account returns "Cannot find WebDAV endpoint" error

note.body:
Hi, here is a rough explanation of the (same?) issue on my side, that I tried to solve with [this MR](/GNOME/gnome-online-accounts/-/merge_requests/292 "goawebdavprovider: do not use services_find_preferred() for webdav").

When trying to add a WebDAV account with GOA, using one server for CardDAV and CalDAV (Cyrus), and one another for WebDAV (a home modified Nginx module, based originally on [nginx-dav-ext-module](https://github.com/arut/nginx-dav-ext-module)), both behind an Nginx proxy, I noticed that even if it seemed to accept the data I entered in the form dialog, the "Files" (i.e. WebDAV) service was not switched ON in GOA, and even if I tried to switch it ON afterwards, the setting did not persist (and actually no WebDAV service was available in GOA for my server).

When checking what could be wrong, I noticed that the `Uri` entry in the file `~/.config/goa-1.0/accounts.conf` was empty, thus just the string `Uri=`. The CalDAV and CardDAV entries were correctly set up and working.

If I did enter the correct Uri in the config file afterwards, I could then switch the "Files" service ON, and it worked correctly (e.g. using Nautilus). Thus it was during the setup of the account that something was going wrong.

I then tried to follow the setup flow of WebDAV in the source, and tried to fix the fact that the `Uri` line was left empty in the config file.

EDITED: issue solved (at least for me), new MR coming next…

This would make a lot of sense to me! If you want to be extra explicit, maybe you want to add "default" in the string above sign-in, so that it reads:

> Sign in to $service with your default browser:
> 
> (Sign In…)

You may want the 2nd string to be above the copy button (for consistency) and be prefixed with "Alternatively" (again if you want to be explicit), something like:

> Alternatively, you can copy the Sign In link to use it with a specific web browser.
> 
> (Copy Link)

Of course the label can still remain under the button if you prefer vertical symmetry instead; that's simply a suggestion in case you feel like matching the ordering is better.

---

Personally I'd suggest we roll with this proposed UI you have here (with or without my proposed changes), and if other designers complain they can propose something better, but this here would already be a _lot_ better than nothing IMHO :)

target_title: Also offer an oauth2 sign-in link that can be copied instead of only directly opening in external browser?

target_title: Also offer an oauth2 sign-in link that can be copied instead of only directly opening in external browser?

note.body:
> Any UX thoughts for that?

I think it could be something like adding a "Copy Link" button next to the "Sign In…" button (presuming you wouldn't want just a hyperlinked word in the text?). Overall, it could look like this, with some explanatory text (presuming you wouldn't want to only put the explanation in a GtkTooltip for the "Copy Link" button):


> ## Google Account
> 
> Authenticate your account with Google with your default web browser using the "Sign In…" button below, or use "Copy Link" to paste the sign-in link to your desired web browser context.

…or something like that. This is assuming that you want to provide an explanation in the UI at all, vs just having the button be there without a particular explanation (presumably, those who need this feature will know what to do with it)…

Anyways, we are now "monitoring" this and also plan to add explicit Intune (ms-oapxbc) support to GOA.

Gnome Online Account setup for iCloud account

note.body:
Oh, thanks. I have verified email works with the GOA settings you gave.

I can't use GOA to setup "Calendar, Contacts and Files". It says "Cannot find WebDAV endpoint" when I use `icloud.com` as the server, and "Authentication Failed" when I use `caldav.icloud.com`. I think the icloud server only supports CalDAV at caldav.icloud.com and CardDAV at contacts.icloud.com only, and not WebDAV.

With Evolution, I can setup everything including Mail, Contacts and Calendars. I enter my email (and server address), and it autodetects the settings for each of those. Would be nice to have in GOA too, so I just enter my email, and it would detect the WebDAV, CalDAV, CardDAV, IMAP and SMTP settings automatically (if possible) and otherwise let me input those manually otherwise.

target_title: Gnome Online Account setup for iCloud account

note.body:
I have just tested the setup again from scratch in a fresh Ubuntu 24.04 VM.
Favoured apps are Geary, Contacts and Calendar (GNOME stock apps).

Mail account added via GOA/IMAP

```
IMAP = imap.mail.me.com SSL/TLS
SMTP = smtp.mail.me.com STARTTLS
USER = <username>@icloud.com
PASSWORD = app-based password
```


The mail account is then available under Geary and Evolution. If the account is set up under Geary, the account cannot be found under GOA.

Strangely enough, Contacts via GOA no longer works with the URL

`https://contacts.icloud.com`

If you use Evolution to set up contacts and calendars, you can find more specific CalDAV/CardDAV URLs there after the setup is complete, but these seem to be customised to the personal iCloud account. So have a look there and read them out. Unfortunately, only the GOA setup of CardDAV works for me with this iCloud user-specific URL.

I can't get calendars working via GOA with the URL

`https://caldav.icloud.com`

nor with the CalDAV URLs read out from Evolution. However, there is a unique, separate CalDAV URL per calendar that Evolution displays after configuration. I cannot set up CalDAV via GOA with any of them.

target_title: Allow specifying the port of the Nextcloud server

note.body:
> I'm not entirely sure why that's needed though just to specify a port.

We could probably make some good guesses here of what a user might input or copy/paste (`http(s)`/`dav(s)`). The specific reason that doesn't work now is we pass that string to formal URI parsing function where `localhost:80`/`mailto:80` can be confused as the scheme.

> Perhaps the examples underneath could show how to specify a port.

Good call. Since I've thought about it, I think we can also make a correct guess at the scheme before parsing, I'll just need to ensure the amended URI is displayed back for the user (we would default to `https`).

note.body:
Yes.  Thank you for pointing out to check gnome settings after authentication.  I resigned in and after authentication the page was "still loading" but my account re-appeared.  I closed my browser window, restarted, and when I saw my account was still in gnome settings I tried to access my drive and said unmountable. Issue is resolved.  

I am using Garuda Linux so you know.

note.body:
Hi, thanks for confirming you checked in with your IT folks.

> The process seems to get stuck after I enter my account, password and enter the number give to me to put into the authentication app (Microsoft authenticator).

At this point, did you check back with GNOME Settings? I'm not sure there is a way for us to close the browser tab or redirect back to the window easily.

> Request Id: 2ab2128d-be48-4843-a308-e74fc7545200 Correlation Id: df3b2501-eb1b-42de-8a27-d9f23a095f2f Timestamp: 2024-10-01T21:18:02Z Message: AADSTS900561: The endpoint only accepts POST requests. Received a GET request.

Can you please provide more information about where this error message is from?

> The IT agent told me that the error AADSTS900561 is related to browsers not allowing third party cookies. I have gone under Firefox privacy, selected custom settings and made sure is not trying to block cookies but the issue is still happening.

I'm not sure about this error message, as we don't control or require cookies. GOA merely opens a URL and waits for a URL to be opened in response.
